result.execSummary:
The defendant Hudson D Ferro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.
Extended Supervision and Probation Conditions the same except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision or successful completion of probation.
Court ordered bail to be applied. Balance of cash bail to be returned pursuant to bail assignment and balance, if any, returned to party who posted.
Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
Vocational/educational training.
Court advises defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor.

No illegal drugs.
No contact with victim and her family.
No contact with children under the age of 18.

Sex offender assessment and comply with treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes:
No good time credit.
Court ordered defendant to serve first 6 months with release for work, treatment, and school after he completes sentence in Waukesha. 
Court stayed balance of sentence to be used as sanctions. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation;
40 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation; 90 days STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 4th violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hudson D Ferro

records.addlTxt: From defense, and employers. Received and filed.

signed and filed.
It is ordered that defendant may serve his sentence of 6 months with work release for work, treatment and school at the Waukesha County Huber Facility if accepted but GPS and electronic bracelet are not authorized.

cg
Attorney came in Clerk's office and was provided an attorney court order bail refund affidavit for surety form to be completed and returned.

Defendant Hudson D Ferro in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Defendant Hudson D Ferro in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Sex Offender assessment and complye with treatment deemed necessary by the department
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No illegal drugs.
*No contact with victim and her family
*No contact with children under the age of 18
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 years with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court ordered defendant to serve 1st 6 months with release for work, treatment and school after he completes sentence in Waukesha.  Court stayed balance of sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 40 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation; 90 days STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 4th violation.
*Sex Offender assessment and complye with treatment deemed necessary by the department
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No illegal drugs.
*No contact with victim and her family
*No contact with children under the age of 18
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision or successful completion of probation.
Court ordered bail to be applied.  Balance of cash bail to be returned pursuant to bail assignment and balance, if any, returned to party who posted.

Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;

AS TO AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms and body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant Hudson D Ferro in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hudson D Ferro in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's motion to admit other acts evidence argued by counsel; granted in part, denied in part, put on the record.  Case remains calendared on 9-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 10.

Filed, Defendant's Supplemental Brief Regarding Other Acts Evidence.
